author: Brett T.
title: Literal echo chamber allows viewers to enjoy every line of Obama‚Äôs farewell speech again and again
text:
Literal echo chamber allows viewers to enjoy every line of Obama‚Äôs farewell speech again and again Posted at 9:37 pm on January 10, 2017 by Brett T. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter 
President Barack Obama spoke before an enthusiastic and rowdy crowd at Chicago‚Äôs McCormick Place Tuesday night, and the venue was set up for maximum rock star impact, right down to the echoing of the president‚Äôs every word. ‚ÄúFour more years‚Äù weren‚Äôt the only words heard over and over. What's up with this echo? #ObamaFarewell 
‚Äî jon gabriel (@exjon) January 11, 2017 ‚ÄúToday (today) I consider myself (myself) the luckiest man (man) on the face of this earth (earth).‚Äù #ObamaFarewell 
‚Äî jon gabriel (@exjon) January 11, 2017 Weird echo from Obama that can be heard audibly on the TV 
‚Äî Josh Kraushaar (@HotlineJosh) January 11, 2017 @HotlineJosh it's the liberal echo chamber. 
‚Äî Jothar Hillpeople (@jothar) January 11, 2017 @HotlineJosh "I am the great and powerful‚Ä¶ Wizard of Oz‚Ä¶ oz‚Ä¶ oz." 
‚Äî Luke Gofannon (@LukeGofannon) January 11, 2017 Obama in a literal echo chamber. Almost like the majority of people on the internet are in figurative echo chamber #ObamaFarewell 
‚Äî Dan Barker (@danbarkr) January 11, 2017 The echoing is awful 
‚Äî Charlie Spiering (@charliespiering) January 11, 2017 Farewell‚Ä¶farewell‚Ä¶farewell‚Ä¶ (echo is not good) 
‚Äî Dana Perino (@DanaPerino) January 11, 2017 In case you don't hear President Obama's speech, you can hear it again 2 seconds later. üò¨ #Echo
